page.title: 06Village survey
page.content: { { {CLATWORTHY On 14 June 1985,a group of pupils from Bishop Fox's School visited the village of Clatworthy to carry out a village study. John Thompson wrote down these answers on his village survey sheet : {Brief Description of Village This is a small, fairly typical Somerset village. I would call it a hamlet rather than a village. There is a church in a rather ruinous state and along the main street is an oddly-shaped house. The house looks as if half of it had been chopped off. There are only two shops, a pottery shop for tourists and a small general store for locals. There is not much for young people to do in the evenings.
